description:
I've walked past this place so many times and never thought to go in because it looked too expensive and hoity-toity. I'm a die hard See's Candie's fan and don't often venture away from the tried and try nuts n' chews bow. Finally ventured in last weekend with friend and glad we decided to take the leap!

The service was impeccable! We got to try a sample of their chocolate and learned a lot about how they are made-most are hand painted!!! The chocolates really are gorgeous and well made. They also taste amazing! I got a box of four and a turtle (dark chocolate with chili and sea salt). My sampler included an earl grey ganache, sea salt, passion fruit and a coffee flavor. 

There's a very cute lounge to sit and enjoy your chocolates. They serve drinking chocolate as well and will try that next time. Definitely would recommend and would make a unique gift for anyone not from SF.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
For my birthday, I got some chocolates from Christopher Elbow. A friend gave them to me on Friday, September 7th a little before 6:30pm.

9-piece Chocolate Collection:
*Bananas Foster: bananas and caramel flambeed with rum
*Fleur De Sel Caramel: caramel infused with grey French sea salt
*Lavender Caramel: caramel infused with French lavender
*Vanilla Bean: caramel infused with Madagascar vanilla beans
*Champagne: milk chocolate ganache blended with French champagne
*Butterscotch Bourbon: aged Kentucky bourbon blended with a brown sugar caramel
*Strawberry Balsamic: caramel made with fresh strawberries and aged balsamic vinegar
*Kalamansi-Lime: milk chocolate ganache infused with fresh lime juice and fragrant kalamansi
*Fresh Lemon: fresh lemon marmalade and lemon infused white chocolate ganache

I've had their chocolates before and they are indeed fancy. I'm not huge on milk chocolate, but I don't mind a piece of very dark or white from time to time. I'm a big fruit person, so I tried the lemon first. It had a nice tartness to it. The banana one had a strong rum flavor which surprised me. Normally alcoholic chocolates aren't that spirit forward in taste. I do like my liquor, so I didn't mind this.The vanilla one was simple. Vanilla and caramel. Who doesn't like that? The lavender caramel one was a little too floral for me. Almost like eating perfume. The rest, I have yet to try, but I'm looking forward to sampling the remaining chocolates.

A lovely birthday treat. Sometimes fancy chocolates can be a little much, but Christopher Elbow is doing it right.
author: Elena N.

description:
So so beautiful, very nice seating area & bathroom. It's really an upscale experience. Fyi, all the colorful round/gem shaped ones are caramels coated with chocolate, while the squares are chocolates. Split four with a friend today (evil chuckle):

Passionfruit caramel--the favorite for both of us, huge burst of fruity flavor, slightly off aftertaste though
Butterscotch bourbon caramel--awesome, so boozy and great bitter notes, close second
Roasted pineapple & jalapeno caramel (the "special")--pretty good, very subtle flavors though, really had to focus to find them
Pistachio bergamot chocolate--great chocolate but couldn't taste either pistachio or bergamot
author: Victoria S.

description: Used to come here all the time but can't believe one of the staff just let another customer cut our line and while she's helping us entering our points she checked out another customer while we are st the register and let yet another stepped in front of us. Very disappointed. Plus there was a fruit fly roaming around the glass counter. It's hard to get these little guys out, and I understand but combined with bad service I had to give a two star. I know the taller staff she always friendly. I feel bad writing this but this place really went down hill a but
author: Dilys S.

description:
Some of the best artisanal chocolates! A bit pricey, and you can see the pricing menu in the photos I posted. Great service here today from the gentleman working here. He helped me choose the best chocolates for the various gifts I needed to buy and was extremely patient since I was so indecisive. I will definitely be back. 

They also serve drinking chocolate. Sounds so good! They also have a small area to hang out and sip on your drinking chocolate. Cute spot!
author: Claire W.

description:
I received a box of chocolates from Christoper Elbow in Valentine's day! and OMG! I absolutely love it.
They are hand painted with beautiful colors. Everyone is different flavor and they have a little bit of liquid inside, so when you bite it the flavor and the liquid mixes in a explosion of sweet and love.
I love chocolate and I love this box of love.
author: Emilio S.

description:
Simply put: scrumptious. A simple note of delicate savory flight amidst the cacophony of the city. 

We stumbled on this jewel in the city and we're delightfully surprised to not only find quality - comparable to some of the best French chocolaterie - and knowledgeable staff. The staff were pleasant and offered tastings - which only made us fall more in love with the correction. 

If this were my store, I'd add more art to the walls and sultry music to fill the gap between the  choco bites.

A definite must see in my book.
author: L M.

description:
Tried their hazelnut drink chocolate. Tasty but after a couple of sips, it got a little overwhelming! Its really is drinking chocolate. I also tried thier almond bite chocolate that was good. 
Fancy place pricey, nice option for chocolate as a gift as they have boxes ready.
author: Vanessa T.

description: There is a very rude woman who works behind the counter. She rolled her eyes at me for asking about the flavors of the chocolates.
author: Michael G.

description:
What a cool venue . Looks a lot fancier/boujee than the actual price. 

A box of 4 chocolates is $10 and there are price breaks as you go up in quantity. 

These chocolates make a great gift.  I've only tried a couple so far so I'll have to edit this review with my favorites but so far I've enjoyed them all.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Chocolate Covered
5 Smitten Ice Cream
6 Teuscher Chocolate 
7 The Ice Cream Bar
8 Coletta Gelato
9 Cako Creamery
10 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
11 Bi-Rite Creamery
12 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
13 Mitchells Ice cream
14 St. Francis Fountain
15 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
16 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
17 Recchiuti Confections 
18 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
The best hot chocolate I have ever had!  I had the cocoa noir with milk and whipped cream.  Just the right amount of sweetness and chocolate.  

I received a can as a gift I hope it tastes just as good!
author: Mitzi W.

description:
Delicious. Refined. Every morsel brims with unique flavor. I'm a sucker for ganache filled chocolates.  These here are quite wonderful.  As good as the 100's I've eaten all over Europe.

And about as pricey as the best Parisian chocolates, which is to say ridiculously expensive.  I purchased a 9 piece box.  Chocolate weight is probably 5 - 6 ounces.  $22 plus tax.  Well, it is packed in a beautiful box wrapped with a silk ribbon.

I'll continue my daily consumption of Trader Joe's Belgian chocolates which I can afford.  These Chris Elbow chocolates are a once a year treat.  Saving up my pocket change in a jar for a future purchase.
author: Tom S.

description: We were motioned in by a nice lady behind the counter as we stood drooling at the window!  We were on our way to dinner next door, but did go in for a small sample.  Based on the sample and the looks of the gorgeous chocolate pieces, I had to go back in after dinner.  And I am so glad I did!  Beautifully hand painted chocolates.  Some are caramel based and some are truffle based.  I ordered a 9 piece box to take with me (of course I had a very hard time picking out which ones to bring home!) and have been enjoying one a day.  These are definitely high quality artisanal chocolates.  $22.00 for a box of 9 chocolates.  Pricey, but you are worth it!
author: Barbara S.

description: I happened by this location while heading to Chantal Guillon. There are lots of artisanal, beautiful chocolate truffles on display and I was at a loss at first of what to choose. Ultimately, I picked the lavender caramel and the cinnamon dulce de Leche for myself and my boyfriend opted for the bananas foster and raspberry truffle. I also purchased another 2 piece gift box as a gift. The gentleman who helped package our chocolates was kind and friendly and we also were offered a sample of a caramel with nuts which was delicious. Overall, I enjoyed each of the truffles: the lavender was a little strong but not bad, the cinnamon dulce de Leche was not strong enough but still delicious, the bananas foster was impressive, and the raspberry truffle was I think my favorite. I wish I had snapped a photo of the display case or the chocolates we purchased because they really were beautiful.
author: Tayler K.

description:
Chocolates of the highest quality, whether you're nibbling daintily at them (all right - let's stop pretending to be modest - make that "wolfing down") or admiring their gorgeous crafting and presentation. 

There's really no flavor that you can go wrong with. Indeed, I'd recommend going out of your comfort zone and trying flavors you might not normally pick. You might be as pleasantly surprised as I was with taking the risk. Flavors that were more on the "safe" side for me, like coffee caramel, butterscotch bourbon, and whiskey pecan, didn't disappoint, while others that I wouldn't usually pick, like strawberry balsamic, lime vanilla, and fresh lemon were delightful surprises.

You can get assorted boxes of chocolates to go, and the staffer was quite patient as I meandered and dithered my way through the entire selection. There's even a small, immaculate seating area if you just can't wait to enjoy your treats. It's all yet another high-end addition to Hayes Valley, which gentrified long ago, but a welcome one at that.
author: Vincent L.

description:
We stopped by Christopher on our way to grab ice cream, as we both got attracted by those pretty truffle pieces. Chocolate caramel, passion fruit, coconut, bourbon, as many flavors as one could even think of, and each piece was nicely made. Pieces of art! 

Inside filling was slightly on the sweeter side, yet indeed tasted great. I liked my bourbon piece and simply wished to try more!
author: Elaine H.

description:
I find it odd how i'm writing this review, when I've never been a chocolate fan.  However, i am a huge hot chocolate fan.   I came here before dinner because it was still early and I needed a place to to relax.  I asked the lady behind the counter what she recommends, and she recommended the Venezuelan chocolate.  I sat down and the brought me my drink, which was way to pretty to drink.  The drink had the perfect spicy to it, so i do recommend it if you like it spicy.  

For the chocolates,  I've only tried a few.  It's not cheap either, so i try to control myself. I love all the ones i've tried.  I have to the raspberry, yuzu,  Champagne, passion fruit, and morello cherry.   A 2 piece box is $6.00 and a 4 piece box is $10.00.  You can say you get what you paid for.   So i recommend this place if you are around this area.
author: Belinda C.

description: The chocolate was so pretty! GOOD gift choice, specially for ladies. They have many many flavors, I was so struggle. I am one of ladies that picky on choices, want to have good flavor and nice shape the same times. The staff was so nice to answer my questions. The only complaint I may have is the chocolate is too sweet, which is not a great deal to me. I will definitely come back for more.
author: Silvia L.

description: Bar none the best chocolatier in the city. Every piece is delicious and beautiful. Their attentiveness is also amazing. In fact, they always remember me and comment about which piece of chocolate my husband likes or usually buys to help me make my selections. Their reward program is also great.
author: Sandy G.

description:
These exceptional treats make no-brainer gifts (I can't justify paying for these chocolates for personal consumption), or simply a beautiful place to sit down for a midday chocolate drink.


---- BONBONS ----

70% Venezuelan:  5 stars
So smooth, it tasted like the highest quality milk chocolate.

Vanilla Bean Caramel:  5 stars


---- CARAMEL PECANS ----

Milk Chocolate Fleur de Sel: 5 stars


---- DRINKING CHOCOLATE ----

Cocoa Noir: 4 stars
With milk and marshmallow. Quite dark and spicy with sour aftertaste (like those single-origin dark choc bars at Dandelion). I'll try it with water instead of milk next time. To be honest, all mass-market snobbery aside, the best drinking chocolate i've ever had was the Iced Chocolate at Godiva.
author: Letitia L.

description: Thank you Rachel! We came here for my daughters 16th birthday and had delicious chocolates and awesome service! You guys helped make my daughter's birthday special. Thank you Rachel and Christopher Elbow! Btw, our favorites were the lemon, the raspberry and the pistachio!
author: Erica D.

description:
A chocolate store above the rest in quality, variety, and deliciousness located in the booming Hayes Valley neighborhood. 

Each tray of beautiful artisanal chocolates is arranged and displayed like jewelry... and when you taste the delicate, liqueur infused bite sized gem, you'll understand why. 

Treat yourself to a thick frothy cup of hot chocolate with a giant marshmallow. Choose milk or water based and milk or dark chocolate with exotic flavors.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
The chocolates are amazing and beautiful, one of the most exquisite delicious experiences we had in a long time.
The reason behind the two starts is the attitude towards the customers. No one spoke to us or paid any attention to us in the store. Finally an employee asked us to pick out the chocolate, but to our surprise, he refused to take our money saying he hasn't finished helping other the customer party. That was unwarranted given that there were four employees and two customer parties including us. It might be they are bad at arithmetics which might explain then not willing to take cash -- afraid of counting it entails. However, this explanation is the unlikely one. It might be we are not regular customers or we don't look right. I don't know what it was but the experience was unpleasant.
author: Anna C.

description:
Incredibly high quality and beautiful chocolates. I got a box of 4 for $10 and each chocolate was a work of art. I would highly recommend it as a gift for someone you really like.

We also got the hazelnut hot chocolate with milk, which was incredibly rich and delicious. Overall, a great spot to stop by when you are in Hayes Valley.
author: Nikita K.

description: This chocolate store does not give samples.  Every chocolate store I know gives samples!
author: Maria T R.

description:
Saw this place when we were eating at chez maman, and although Im not a sweets/chocolate person, I was super intrigued so we stopped in. Bf and I each had a piece of chocolate. I truly enjoyed the salted hazelnut praline truffle I got.. perfect size, rich without being too overly sweet, and one piece was decadent enough for me.

Bf got the vanilla bean caramel. I cannot comment on it bc that selfish guy ate his entire piece without offering to share. -_____- luckily the lady saved him from my wrath..bc from behind the counter, she witnessed the entire exchange and came back w a new piece of chocolate, cut in half, for us to split. 

Definitely a good place to pick up nice chocolates for a gift for a chocolate lover.. or yourself. Will definitely come back for a piece of that salted hazelnut praline!!
author: Michelle N.

description: This man knows his chocolate.  Elbows' chocolates are unique, creative, nicely presented and, above all, delicious.  They are on the pricey side, but the quality is definitely on point.  I also tried the hot chocolate, which was fine.  I didnt enjoy it as much as others, but I think it's just because I prefer milk chocolate.  Still, I'm a fan of this place.
author: Angel S.

description:
I love this place !! The atmosphere, friendly service, the aroma in entire place !!
Their chocolate drink is superb. I've never taste rich chocolate drink like this before !
I tried it with water not with milk and like the server lady said it brought more chocolaty flavor.
Ecuador dark 71% is the one I tried and it just made my day !
author: Sati I.

description:
If you are a chocolate fan, you cannot beat Christopher Elbow! Located in Hayes Valley, this place offers a variety of chocolate items including truffles, toffees, and caramels for your enjoyment.  When I first walked in, I admired the contrast between the clean, white decor and the colorful chocolates on display.  The huge assortment of items can be overwhelming, since it can be hard to know which awesome item to pick first!

During my visits, the staff have been helpful and patient in explaining the different flavor varieties.  While the truffles are small, they are packed with flavor! I also thought the caramels were delectably filled with nuts and a gooey filling that contrasted well with the salt sprinkled on top.  When you visit, it will take a test of will to limit yourself to just one purchase!
author: Keith H.

description: This review is for the spiced chocolate drink. I was looking for something similar to the spiced chocolate I had in Mexico, and whilst this is not the same, it is similar and surprisingly good. The chocolate is not overpowered by the spices, nor is it too sweet for my Asian/continental European taste. I initially hesitated at the $5 price tag but it's the price of a coffee or boba tea and you're really getting more value for money. Well worth every penny. The shop itself is elegantly simple, where you can sit down and sip your chocolate. It reminds me of hotel du Chocolat in Oxford.
author: Emily P.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing. I was hoping to try some of their liquid chocolate after first getting exposed to it in Portland this past winter. First of all, when I walked into the store, I was completely stunned by the presentation of their chocolates. Each piece of chocolate looked like a beautiful piece of decoration that should not be touched, let alone eaten. 

I ended up ordering the roasted hazelnut praline liquid chocolate. It was the best drinking chocolate I have ever had! It wasn't too heavy as most liquid chocolates are but it was definitely a lot richer than a simple hot chocolate. I would highly recommend this place to everyone, especially chocolate lovers!
author: Catherine S.

description:
This is by far my favorite artisan chocolate place ever. Each chocolate is carefully crafted to showcase the unique flavor combinations. My favorites are the Salted Hazelnut Praline, Passion Fruit Caramel, Champagne, and Lavender Carmel. These are perfect gifts to impress your manager or coworkers! 

I've also tried their Mocha hot chocolate. Pretty hefty price tag for the amount of liquid they give you but it's definitely worth it. The hot chocolate is super rich and not overly sweet.

Packaging is also really cute!
author: Michelle C.

description: My daughter and I had the yummiest and most decadent hot chocolates there this week. The counter person also gave us samples of their delicious bourbon caramel chocolate. I'm glad we went around the block a couple of times to find parking. Will definitely be back.
author: Roshan L.

description: The chocolates are very delicious. All very good quality and the drinking chocolate is great as well. My favorite is passion fruit caramel and vanilla bean caramel. Very pricey that's the only downside
author: Russell T.

description: Great quality of products and good service. They have the best chocolate milk I ever had. I'm definitely coming back in the future.
author: Or B.

description: Such beautiful looking chocolates, but don't expect cash back if you don't use up all of your gift receipt.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
These guys have some really good artisanal chocolates. They have experimented and most of their experiments have turned out to be good.

I really like their pecan chocolate, dark chocolate and yuzu one. If you have a super sweet tooth go for the yellow one(lemon).
author: Ramyata M.

description:
Cool place to visit.  We got one of the chocolate drinks and tried a few of the chocolates.  The bananas foster chocolate candy was like someone dropping a taste- bomb in my mouth; it had a liquid center, so if u try to bite in half, the liquid will spill out.

Even before we left, my daughter wanted to know when we could come back, lol.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Amazing hot chocolate! Perfectly thick. Multiple different base options (water, milk, coconut milk, etc). Lots of different flavors/enhancements but perfect as is. Perfect temperature, flavor, everything.

Now I just need to try all their actual chocolates.

Would LOVE if had some high end croissants or cookies or some type of baked good to enjoy with the hot chocolate.
author: Ryan B.

description: Delicious and surprising flavors. The balsamic chocolate was immensely flavorful! I got a large assorted box for myself, as well as a sleeve of the Pâté de Fruit and another box of chocolates for my in-laws. They loved them as well. All of the chocolates and other confections were absolutely beautiful.
author: Benjamin I.

description: The chocolates looked very fancy and colorful. It's good for a gift. The service of salespersons could be better and more welcomed.
author: Jessie L.

description: Chocolate is awesome, very dedicate but very enjoyable. Highly recommand fruit flavor chocolate. I tried all of chocolate in store. But fruit flavors are the best!!! Not to mentioned the associate is very friendly and well knowledge about their chocolate. I love it. Best choice for spoil myslef(or gift for friend!)
author: Tsai J.

description:
This place has amazing chocolate! 

The store is really fancy with a simple decor. They sell different kinds of artisanal chocolate and some beverages. 

As the name says, their chocolate is a piece of art. It has some very cool geometrical shapes and the chocolates look so pretty that you will feel bad for ruining such a beautiful thing. But your taste buds will thank you for it. 

My favorite is the chocolate turtle. If you don't like it too sweet, get the dark chocolate one. It has a caramel filling and some flakes of sea salt on top of it. Simply delicious.
author: Andréia S.

description:
Tiny masterpieces.

Sadly, Christopher Elbow opened this shop long before I had the pleasure.  A good friend of mine lives right across the street, so for a long time, I'd walk by & just look & lust.

Once I finally decided to turn that lust into reality, a few characteristics about myself were reaffirmed...

I love bananas foster, so I have to have it.  

I'll never skip an earl grey.  

I'm always compelled to order lavender.

And the girly girl in me has to order the champagne.

But, my favorite so far is easily the strawberry balsamic.

A box of these babies is a real statement.  They're like jewels in the night.  Precious & striking, & I'm not used to using such words to describe chocolates.

Honorable mention goes to the Venezuelan spice, & the whiskey.  Well, actually, to all the flat "canvas" pieces.  They're so fabulous.

First rate chocolates.  And a feast for the eyes.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Absolutely delicious - I'd been looking for these kinds of chocolates in the city for quite a while, and this seems to be one of the only places around. Will definitely be going back!
author: Mark M.

description:
"This chocolate has been rated, #10 Best Chocolatier in the country," the girl behind the counter exclaims as we walk in the door. 

Of course that's a nice fact to hear, but all I was concerned about was looking through the glass at the options, that would soon be picked and meeting the tastebuds on my tongue. 

Whoa.. They also have hot chocolate available made with water or milk. I was feeling extra celebratory as my friend and I just completed our teacher trainings we have been working at extensively for over two years. 

"Yes, I'll take the hot chocolate made with water." I practically screamed at her. :)

I also picked two chocolates to indulge: Macadamia Praline (caramelized macadamia and almonds blended with milk chocolate and sea salt) AND Lavender Caramel- caramel infused with French Lavender. 

Yum! Delicious. Satisfying. Satiating. Wow. : )

The store is very clean! There are places to sit for small parties ( like one- two people), with padded bench seats and little marble armrest or mini tables in to set your goodies on in between each seat. 

I shall return... Mmmm.
author: Cassandra E.

description: I got a box of chef's choice. I absolutely love these. I'm a great fan of chocolate and I liked all of them. Great gift for someone as well. Each candy is a piece of art
author: Natasha R.

description:
Absolutely gorgeous decadent fine chocolate! If you're looking to impress your wife, girlfriend, or even your boss.....you can't go wrong with them. 

The associate named Eileen, I think is her name and she wears glasses, great person with honest recommendations. She will tell you what she likes as well as what others have usually bought and their responses so you can feel confident that your specially crafted box looks good and taste good! It is a bit pricy, but really worth it when it comes to presentation.
author: Semhar G.

description:
I typically try to stop by "the best" chocolatier in the city I'm visiting to purchase a box of chocolate, and this place appeared to be one of the best (given the distance from my hotel). 

The shop is extremely modern, bright, sleek, and clean.  Love it. They have prepackaged boxes of chocolate as well as ones you can customize.  Same price for either option.  All the chocolate pieces looked gorgeous (including the packaging) and sounded so delicious and unique.  The manager of the store even offered us each a sample which consisted of champagne, and it was delicious. 

The 10 minutes I was standing in that store made me wish I was a chocolatier.  I would emulate exactly everything they're doing.  Made me sad that we don't have a shop like this in Houston (I've tried C&C and was not impressed).  I guess I'll have to settle for ordering their chocolate online.  Until next time, San Francisco.
author: Miranda L.

description:
If you're looking for the best hot cocoa ($5) of your life, look no further than Christopher Elbow. 

They have three different styles: 
Cocoa noir: 65% dark chocolate with whole milk 
European style: 85% dark chocolate with water 
Extra dark: 85% dark chocolate with water or milk 

You can also choose from 12 exotic flavors, so we went with the Ginger caramel. OH MY GOODNESS - I have no words for this amazingness. Also, you have the option to top it off with house made Madagascar vanilla bean marshmallow or hand made whipped cream (or both if you ask really nicely like we did). 

Amanda is amazing, might I add. She helped us choose between all the flavors, and made sure our hot cocoa extra special. The sitting area is lovely, with smooth leather benches and floor to ceiling windows. 

The chocolate bonbons are PERFECT, especially if you're looking for a beautiful gift. While we were looking at the menu, Amanda offered us a whiskey pecan bonbon (while she was replenishing a tray) because it wasn't perfect enough to display!
author: Angela F.

description: I consistency buying chocolate from this store. It is also a good place to sit down and have some drinks with friends. The only concern is the parking. But I still love to go.
author: Tiffy L.

description: Though it could be a 4-5 star experience depending on who's making your hot chocolate.  The quality of the hot chocolate was amazing and it's such a cute place to enjoy a cup there.  It would be great to have more places to sit and enjoy a cup of hot chocolate though.  Both their passion fruit and raspberry flavors are amazing!  This will definitely become a regular place for me.
author: M. T.

description: Scrumptious and decadent. Worth trying all of them. The fancy hot chocolates are irresistibly delicious. The people behind the counter are also friendly! Great for gifts.
author: Jim G.

description:
I did not taste the chocolates. I bought them as a gift. They looked beautiful, the person who answered the phone was efficient, helpful and pleasant. Nevertheless, I hate Christopher Elbow Chocolate. Since the day I looked them up on line, every website I visit has a Christopher Elbow ad smack in the middle.
Nobody buys fancy and expensive candy daily. It makes no sense to bombard a buyer with ads, unless they want to alienate their customers. They succeeded with me.
author: Josephine M.

description: Great chocolate, but there lady with the bad lipstick was very impatient and rude. Not coming back.
author: Katerina B.

description: Wandered over to this place between watching Swan Lake and waiting for the SF Symphony to start. Super cute and very fancy chocolate shop. Prices are high but once you try their chocolate you understand why. I bought an assortment but the ones that stick out as most delicious were their lavender caramel and the bananas foster. Both filled with flavor and delicious. They also serve drinks but I didn't try one, maybe next time. The staff were knowledgable, cheery and patient which made the visit that much more enjoyable. A perfect little spot for a bit of chocolate indulgence.
author: Angela D.

description:
Ok I'm not sure why this place isn't packed all of the time.  Here now chilling out of the 103° heat and enjoying the best Drinking Chocolate San Francisco has to offer.   The hard part is deciding which type to choose. 
 
For Dark Chocolate Lovers: Try with water instead of milk. 

Chocolates are amazingly flavored but expensive.
author: Dean P.

description: Outstanding chocolates that are a treat to give and receive.  Great hostess, birthday & xmas gifts.  Love the passion fruit and the drinking chocolates... like chocolates, but love these chocolates for so many reasons.
author: karen c.

description: This place is a secret gem. I stumbled in here on a rainy day looking for cover, and was delighted by what I saw. Beautiful chocolates, each a piece of art, and the richest, most creative hot chocolate ever.  The lady working at the counter provided top notch, friendly service. There is a little cafe part, where we were able to sip our hot chocolate, to nice music. Unfortunately I live in San Jose and can't come often, but next time I need a gift for someone in SF (or a chocolate fix), I will think of this place.
author: Anonymous P.

description: I'm not a chocolate person but I thought their dark chocolate sample was delicious. The guy behind the counter created a welcoming atmosphere, was very friendly and helpful and had a passion for the products. I had just eaten a huge brunch, so I wasn't in the mood to buy a bunch of candy, but it was nice to look at all the different chocolates and inventive flavors.  Each piece has such an amazing sheen to it.  You can tell these are very finely crafted pieces.  They apparently also have liquid chocolate with flavor add-ins too.
author: Christina G.

description:
I absolutely love chocolate, so I just had to come here after seeing a friend post an Instagram photo of Christopher Elbow's liquid chocolate. 

My boyfriend and I came here maybe two weeks ago with the intention of just buying drinking chocolate, but were surprised to find that Christopher Elbow had a wide variety of chocolates and gift items. 

Upon arrival, we were greeted by Amanda, the friendly worker behind the counter, and were given samples of Ghana chocolate, which was absolutely delicious.

I told her that we came to try a liquid chocolate, and asked if she had any recommendations. We ended up going with the hazelnut drinking chocolate made with water instead of milk, as she explained that it would be a bit too rich with milk. I was glad we listened to her, as our drink was absolutely perfect the way she made it. 

Upon ordering, Amanda asked us if we wanted our drink to be topped with a marshmallow or whip cream. We got ours with a marshmallow, which even I surprisingly liked (I don't like marshmallows, but my boyfriend does). While she was ringing us up, she told us that if we drank a bit off the top, she would top us off with the remaining liquid chocolate she had, which was super sweet. 

Our decadent drinking chocolate, which satisfied both of our chocolate cravings, came out to $4.50, a fair price for what I believe is the best "hot chocolate" I've ever had. The gift items are also fairly priced, so I would definitely recommend checking them out.

The individual chocolates are a bit pricey, coming in at $2 a piece, if I remember correctly. However, Christopher Elbow chocolates do a great job fusing chocolate with art, as each piece is beautifully crafted. 

The shop's decor is also very modern and inviting. The back section of the shop, which is very well lit and comfortably quiet, is open to customers to sit and enjoy their purchases. However, if you're planning to come here in a big group, I would suggest taking your chocolate items to go, as the space doesn't have very many seats. 

I would definitely recommend giving this place a try if you love high quality, artisanal chocolates.
author: Janelle C.

description: Stopped in to get some chocolates to impress the in laws. The chocolate displays are laid out beautifully with lots of design elements and color. The pricing is reasonable from $12 all the way up to $96 for their largest box. You can also customize your box with your own favorite flavors. The service was great as I wasn't rushed and got all my questions answered by the sales woman. The treats aren't for me, but I did get to sample the champagne chocolate and it was incredible.
author: Reshmi V.

description: Amazing amazing amazing chocolates and other things sweet and tasty. If you need to apologize for something, want to be amorous with someone, need to make up for social awkwardness, score points with coworkers, butter up flight attendants, or just want damned fine chocolates, come here to get them.
author: Mike L.

description: The best hot chocolate i've ever had. Their chocolates are really good. I always purchase their Venezuelan dark chocolates.
author: Nagini A.

description:
Life is like a box of chocolates. And if you come here, you'll get a very tasty box full of beautiful chocolates. 

I've been a fan of this little place on Hayes for a few years now. This is where I come to veg out after a day of eating, hoping, wine drinking on Hayes. This is where I come to grab my pretty boxes to take home to and give gifts to. This is also a place I always stop by on my way to the airport and nearly missed few flights back home. 

What can a girl do in such amazing shop except squeal and marvel??! Ahhh! Luckily, they are not in Seattle. Or unluckily since I have to make a trip  three times a year just for this. Still, I'm not complaining.

Nestle in the corner of a busy Hayes street, you'll either miss this place walking by or walk right in and not leave.

Love-
Chocolates! All the prettiest of the pretty artisan chocolates in all different shapes and colors. They are on the pricier side but have you seen the details on them?? Seriously! They look like jewels. So beautiful and so tasty!

Venezuelan spice hot chocolates- super rich but the spice is tasty. 
Fav chocolates- Spiced Orange ( beautiful!) , Passion Fruit Caramel, Fleur del sel caramel, Lavender caramel, Bana Foster( with rum!) Champagne! Ahh so many favorite flavors.

Boxes are $32 for 16 pieces and $42 for 21 pieces. I also love their drinking chocolates to go. As well as their Dark Spice and Dark ginger bars! Overall, this is a modern day chocolate factory.  

It is simple, cute and small-ish place covered with amazingly stunning and tasty chocolate pieces calling your name. I can NEVER go in here and not buy myself a box or two. I can always get it online but where's the fun in that?! Walking in here , smelling , tasting and picking the perfect pieces out? Now that's fun! Eating a few pieces and sipping their drinking chocolates after you get your boxes? That's even better. Can't wait come back and get my paws all over it. Can't wait!!!
author: Latifa S.

description: Delicious drinking chocolate. We ordered spicy dark and Ecuador drinking chocolate with 2 different kinds of marshmallow. Both drinks were smooth, rich and just the right amount of sweet and chocolatey. Will be returning to try their truffles :)
author: Tanu T.

description:
The store is small and straight forward. 

There is a display case of little chocolate pieces that are mostly too pretty to eat (but you do it anyway). There were so many to choose from but out of everything that I had bought for myself that day already (I splurged a lot that day), I only chose one chocolate piece to try. 

I got the Lavender Caramel. Pretty little purple piece. Vibrant violet with a shimmer...looks fake but the chocolate is just tempered and crafted very well.

It was just as delicious as it was to look at. Rich, creamy caramel with a good amount of lavender. Lavender is really hit or miss with most people but I like lavender a lot and I really liked this piece. Personally, I think lavender flavors are best when they're more understated so I almost feel like I would have liked a white chocolate lavender instead...but this is worth trying.

First piece I've ever waited for and tried. Can't wait to try other ones on days when I feel like I really deserve it.
author: Sofia R.

description:
The artisanal chocolates at Christopher Elbow are delicious!  They are a bit pricey, at $2 each, and it's hard not to try them all.  But I got 3 and it was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth.  I ordered the bananas foster, strawberry balsamic, and lemon citrus.  Remember that everlasting gobstopper from Willy Wonka that made Violet turn violet?  That's how I felt about the bananas foster.  It was like I was eating a bananas foster!  The strawberry balsamic had a hint of that tangy flavor, and the lemon citrus had a wonderful aroma.

I really like the decor and atmosphere.  The cafe is a quiet place were you can take your time tasting the chocolate.  My coworker and I may have been a bit rambunctious for the patriots there at the time because we were just too excited.

I would love to come back and try one of their drinks.
author: Vira P.

description:
I had walked into CE really just to browse, possibly pick up a few little gifts for people back home from my San Francisco trip, and maybe subconsciously/involuntarily thought maybe I could buy something for myself too haha. Behind the glass partition were these beautifully made chocolates that I had to absolutely get, and if I happen not to give some away, i would eat some too. 

The staff that day were really helpful. I had noticed the different size gift boxes for sale but it really wasnt what I had in mind. The lady behind the counter said they would pack the truffles individually into little plastic baggies if I wanted to, so that's what I ended up going with. Even in the cheap plastic baggies, the presentation was beautiful!

The chocolate? DELICIOUS. It still had that bitter coco bean flavor, none of that fragrant taste you get from Godiva and the super milkyness of Lindt. It was smooth and silky; tempered, not tampered Chocolate.

My favorite item? The FLEUR DE SEL TURTLE. I bought a Milk Chocolate version. OHMAAHGAWDDD! For $3 you cant beat it, its like mini hockey puck - definitely had some weight on it! Amazing caramel on the inside, with huge grains of salt on the exterior. You can't go wrong with one or 17.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Best artisanal, creative chocolate varieties I've tried and I'm a big fan of chocolate who tasted many types from all over the world. Presentation, variety of different flavors and combinations are excellent. This can pleasantly surprise even the toughest chocolate snobs. These box sets also make awesome holiday gifts, just make sure to buy some extra ones or you might end up keeping them for yourself!
author: Steve C.

description:
Decided to stop by after being disappointed at Chantal Guillon Macarons. The chocolates displayed looked like works of arts. They looked too pretty to eat!

I know some people felt the employees were either smug or flat, but the lady who helped me was very sweet and patient while she was helping me choose which chocolates to buy. 

I bought a box of 9 for $20. Yes, it is pretty pricey for some chocolates but I felt like treating myself and my fiance (my fiance LOVES chocolate).

Here are the ones I got:

-Pumpkin Spice (limited holiday one): LOVED!
-Fleur De Sel Caramel: Good but wasn't memorable
-Lavender Caramel: Wasn't my taste but if you like lavender then you'll like it
-85% Extra Dark: YUM! But I love dark chocolate
-Macadamia Praline: I think I would have liked this more if it was dark chocolate but it' still good
-Ghana: LOVED this one too
-Passion Fruit Caramel: LOVED this one too!
-Russian Tea: I wasn't too keen on this one
-Coffee Caramel (limited edition one): I really don't remember this one so I guess it wasn't bad or amazing

If this was in LA, I probably would walk by and buy a $2 treat and be on my merry way :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
Christopher Elbow is an old favorite. After years and years of SF Boys Chorus and SF Girls Chorus, I have haunted every Hayes Valley location and then some. Especially during the holidays when rehearsals at Davies Symphony Hall were long and frequent. 

I already wrote that their liquid chocolate comes in a number of different flavors and it is just over-the-top deliciousness. Their service continues to be top-notch (save for some black Friday craziness, but they get a pass for that). So on this day, a Friday morning with not too many customers, the lovely gal lived up to what I expected in service. There were samples offered to the kids while I was in the restroom (and btw, I'm obsessed with their sink - please check out their bathroom while you're there - in fact I'm going to post a photo) and when I returned they had each almost finished their selections of chocolates. They also have seating that is super-comfy. 

All-around enjoyable experience here.
author: Laurie H.

description: You come in. Look at all the chocolates. Then you pick one and just one because one piece is $2, but it's well worth it. Make sure you eat the chocolate on the leather couches in the back of the store. Snap a quick photo for social media then close your eyes, take a bite, sit back and enjoy!
author: David H.

description:
I'm a huge chocolate lover. Lately, I've become the newest fan of this chocolate boutique. So much that we ordered a box of chocolates from their website to have it delivered to our home. This is some of the highest quality and beautifully-designed chocolate I've ever seen.

The service of this Hayes location was good. Not stellar, but the chocolates made up for the mediocre service. Perfect for giving as a gift to a loved one, to bring to special events, or to just enjoy on your own.

Do not hesitate to order from their website as well. The service was amazing, and the chocolates arrived well-packaged, wrapped with a cooler, and unharmed. Each truffle has such unique flavors, and are so delicate that they quite literally melt in your mouth unlike the traditional rich and hefty truffles from say, Godiva or See's. These are so flavorful and light that it truly is difficult to enjoy just 2 or 3. ;)
author: Jenny B.

description:
Christopher Elbow is my second favorite chocolatier with a shop in the Bay Area -- and that's saying a lot. His boutique shop in Hayes Valley is a must whenever I'm in the city, and I always get his boxed sets as gifts for family and friends.  Here are my chocolate notes:

The fruity series

Fresh lemon
- very refreshing, with the tart lemon providing a nice balance to the sweetness of the white chocolate 

Pineapple
- milk choco ganache blended with pineapple, in a creamy milk choco shell. Not too sweet, just right amount of tangy flavor with sweetness. Edges out the fresh lemon. 

Strawberry balsamic
- a novelty piece: strawberry with aged balsamic vinegar wrapped in white choco. However, I would rate it better if they changed the white chocolate shell to dark or milk choco

Fresh raspberry
- A piece that is characteristic of Christopher Elbow's whimsical take on chocolates: sweet raspberry pate which matches well with dark choco. 

Mango basil
- dark chocolate with mango pate and basil ganache. Sounds good, but tastes just ok.

Fig and port wine

- this complex chocolate blend is truly unique and a cut above the rest. It does need an open mind to appreciate it. It has fig jam with the sweet strong taste of port. An acquired taste, but I personally like it. 


The nutty series 

Macadamia praline 
- Dark choco shell. milk choco ganache with caramelized mac bits and sea salt.
- I have nothing to say other than this is my fave piece of his selection!

Caramel pecan marzipan 
- I'm not a big fan of marzipan, but this one really works for me -- pecan marzipan with salted caramel ganache.

Peanut praline
- this is a nutty and crunchy piece compared to the peanut bonbons at other chocolatiers, which is perfectly fine by me ;) 

Citrus hazelnut praline 
- Did I say the macadamia praline was my favorite Christopher Elbow bonbon?  Move over, because I think this one is!
- caramelized hazelnuts with milk choco, and tinge of orange zest.  refreshing and nutty at the same time. Love!

Cookie butter 
- it's not a praline, but it feels nutty and it's got crunch!
- if u like crunchy speculoos, then this is that wrapped in dark chocolate 
- not my fave, but I like it!!

The caramel series 

Fleur de sel 
- caramel wrapped in dark choco. Nice slightly salty aftertaste but the caramel is too liquid. I like Michael Mischer's version a little better

Vanilla caramel 
- almost like the fleur de sel.  caramel infused with madagascar vanilla bean, wrapped in a dark chocolate shell. 
- a bit sweet but still tolerable

Passion fruit caramel 
- slightly better than Chocolatier Blue's passion fruit piece. 
- I love passion fruit. This one is with a white choco shell. I don't normally like white choco, but I'll let it go for this piece. It's a good mix. 
- a must have for me when at Chris Elbow's. 
 
Rosemary caramel
- novelty piece: herb and chocolate blend done right. subtle with creamy deep milk chocolate. 
 
Banana foster
- a little too sweet for me


The hockey pucks

Dark hazelnut
- almost as good as Nuubia's hazelnut bar. 
- hazelnut ganache with crunchy nutty bits wrapped in dark chocolate 
- one upgrade would be to add caramel, but I think that's what the turtle puck is for. 

Dark Venezuela chili spice
- if you like it spicy... 

Dark turtle (sea salt caramel + nut)
- most popular puck. Rightly so! Must have. 


The bars

He had several different flavors, but my faves are:

71% dark with toffee and Hawaiian red salt

71% dark with pop rocks
 


Overall verdict and what to get:

- citrus hazelnut praline,  Mac praline, cookie butter, caramel pecan, peanut, passion fruit and hazelnut puck

- Overall, Christopher Elbow has a great location, cool vibe and artsy/refined chocolates that are as good as it looks.  His pieces have a lot of character -- I almost feel like I know Christopher already just with a bite of his whimsical pieces. I'm going to guess that he is a lively personality who knows his stuff but doesn't take himself too seriously. This Hayes Valley gem is a keeper!
author: Dawne L.

description: Amazing chocolate , very friendly staff , worth the money (if you have some extra cash to spare ) I loves the lemon & chai tea one .
author: Li S.

description:
Coconut curry cocoa noir drinking chocolate was pretty good. It tasted like curry with chocolate, in a good way. I also had the raspberry cocoa noir and that was good as well. But i think I preferred the curry over the raspberry.

Their chocolates are good. I had the Earl Grey and it was smooth and creamy and not too sweet.
author: Heejin L.

description:
REJOICE...CHOCOLATE LOVERS!
The Hayes Valley neighborhood has a little gem of sweetness that is not to be missed.  If one loves fine art, then one is sure to appreciate the artfulness of these treasures that are difficult to initially bite into...until of course, one cannot control one's curiosity of how delectable these little gems can truly be.  These are definitely both visually and culinarily pleasing!

CEAC is known for their Turtles, Bon Bons & hot chocolate.

Just as See's Candies offers their patrons a sample just for visiting, so does CEAC, except on a much higher level...the ultimate Bon Bon level!  The day we  explored their shop, they were offering a full sized sample of the, Russian Tea Bon Bon.  Mmmmm...a lingering smile of pure happiness glistened across our faces!

Of our purchased sweets, my favorite was the Passion Fruit Caramel.  We also shared a cup of their rich, hot chocolate.  As it was so rich and delectable, we were unable to consume it all in one sitting.  We were advised to store it in the refrigerator and enjoy it as a pudding the next day.  Lo and behold, it was exactly that...a creamy decadent chocolate pudding!

Delicious fruity bites to try are their, Pate de Fruit.  It's a remarkable concentrate of flavorful fruit jellies packed into bite-sized morsels.

So if you're in the area, or care to go out of your way to experience "decadent art", pay a visit to CEAC; your taste buds will thank you!
author: Jeanie L.

description:
Considering the immensely sweet tooth I possess, it's shocking how I'm not necessarily a huge fan of chocolate. Don't get me wrong, I love chocolate flavors but I don't like eating actual pieces of chocolate. Something about the hard texture rubs me the wrong way. So why 5 stars you ask? 

THE HOT CHOCOLATE. Oh dear god, the hot chocolate. These are not just regular hot cocoas that you can get at any coffee shop. It's literally liquid chocolate and with the most incredible flavor selection that would be a nightmare for the indecisive. My personal favorite was the Venezuelan spice drinking chocolate which made my taste buds all tingly! I also had the hazelnut and the masala spices hot chocolates and was blown away. Really, you can't go wrong with any of the liquid chocolates here! 

Considering the liquid chocolates are so delicious, I would extrapolate a similar 5 stars for all the solid chocolate lovers out there. 

So on your next window shopping and galavanting trip through Hayes Valley, do not forget to stop by Christopher Elbow for the hot chocolate experience of a lifetime!

Happy Eating/Drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: It really doesn't matter what flavor you pick, it'll all good!! Just depends on you and your palate, Enjoy a l'll piece of heavenly chocolate.
author: Diane V.

description:
A few things seem to have changed since I last yelped...

The staff is now friendly (for a while) and their chocolates still great...we love them..
author: Barb L.

description:
Dear Mr. Elbow ( I just had to write that),

You are the "sweet genius"! 

First of all your free samples put to shame crack dealers....yes I am now addicted to your Venezuelan spice chocolate, your 70% Venezuelan dark chococlate, and the most evil of all your machinations those spicy light chocolate turtles....darn you

Perhaps the most visual stunning chocolates I have seen....each a work of art in its own right. Their Caramels are sooo tasty.

Help is great, although with one salesperson and many clamoring for  chocolates for the holidays....patience is a virtue.

48 piece box is 80 bucks...cheap it is not...but the quality is far superior to many expensive competitors....

Stop by for the free samples kids....you will be back!
author: David G.

description: These are my absolute most favorite chocolates of all time!!! The tequila lime is like an explosion of rainbows in your mouth. I LOVE this place. I always make a stop when I'm in the neighborhood and will continue to.
author: Melissa M.

description: There are not enough good words to describe this place. They have destroyed hot chocolate for me forever in the sense that I will never find a hot chocolate as good as theirs. It's a liquid sipping chocolate which is rich but the greatest thing you'll ever have. They have different flavors. I choose a peanut butter and it had a slightly toasted marshmallow on top. It was to die for. Service was top and on point. My husband and I got a few different chocolates to try and everyone was even more delicious than the next. Parking in the area can be a little difficult but if you don't mind circling the block a few times I highly recommend it. This place will not disappoint
author: Anna M.

description:
This place. Indulgent. Artistic. Stunning. Flavorful. Inventive. Sexual. Yes sexual. In the way that if I had to choose between bonbons and sex... Bonbons. I had the lime chocolate a few days ago and I am still dreaming of it. I also enjoyed the earl  grey chocolate, the bergamot flavor was present without being too much. I will return again and again. The ultimate treat yo'self*.

*if you are the kind of peasant that splurges on a king size kit kat, know that each bite comes at a premium. Two dollars per bonbon. But I can't tell you enough, it's worth it. 

Well done Christopher Elbow
author: Amanda E.

description:
I hadn't heard of this place before, but I got a nice gift as a surprise.

They have lots of interesting flavors. I tried: 
1. Champagne: tasted more like a light berry flavor rather than champagne 
2. Fleur de sel: salted caramel, a bit sweet in the center 
3. Coffee: like an intense darker chocolate
4. Venezuelan: you can taste some spice

The flavors are a bit subtle, but the chocolates were beautifully made, and the tempering was nice.
author: Marilyn T.

description: OMG!  I was skeptical before I came, but I'm in heaven enjoying literally the BEST liquid chocolate of my life right now.  I am so lucky today that I am the only customer in the lounge, so I can enjoy the peace and quiet without the crowd.  This place has just become my Mecca for cocoa.
author: Dominic L.

description:
I have such great friends.

You know why? they keep my chocolate jar full. (some people have cookie jars, I have a chocolate jar)

I look forward to friend's trips abroad because it's guaranteed that I'll get chocolates, but the ones I'm really excited about are chocolates from Christopher Elbow.

Priced at $2 each, these little delights are elegant to look at and taste like it too.

The Venezuelan Spice is a dark ganache infused with a chili spice blend. It is melt in your mouth good.

The Banana Rum is a milk chocolate with a rum liquer center. It is heaven in a box good.

The Fleur de Sel is a soft caramel ganache made with French sea salt. Oui, oui. It is finger lickin good. 

By far, Champagne is my fave flavor. Coming from a girl who likes bubbly, how can you go wrong with this flavor?!  Moet and Chandon champagne blended with milk and dark chocolate into a creamy ganache.  It is, SERIOUSLY, make me want to drop my panties good! (disclaimer: line used solely for the purposes of this review)

If you want to be a great friend or simply impress someone, think no further than a box (or two) of Christopher Elbow chocolates. How will she react? happy? excited? who knows?

Life is like a box of chocolates. You just never know what you're gonna get.  ;-)

* For Bobby L, great friend and supplier of fine chocolates *
author: Janice C.

description: Very delicious chocolates. I love the cool designs. The staff is very helpful. Kate was extremely patient and offered warmth and humor while I made up my mind. Some time I'll have to try the hot chocolate.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: One of my favorite chocolate stores. Each chocolate has a unique design and flavor that has been hand-crafted by an artist. The store manager, Amanda, is the best; she gives an excellent customer satisfaction and always makes customers happy.  Feel free to try a sampler of their lovely chocolate on your next visit.  Whenever you buy an item, you will receive points and get free chocolates.
author: Moaid M.

description: Place is great fun but apparently I'm just not sophisticated enough. I love me a good piece of chocolate and each one I bought was...okay. Subtle, interesting, but not mind-blowing or memorable enough that I could get myself to spend the money again.
author: Daniel E.

description:
Best advice I have gotten all week, was to stop by here for a $2 treat.

Most of the lovely chocolates are $2.The staff loves to arrange the beautiful chocolates into pieces of art, definitely let them design your box of chocolates.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I have a serious problem living so close to this place...I really am here all the time because the chocolates are just that good! 


My favs are the bananas foster and chocolate orange. Their hot chocolates are also really amazing - much thicker than anything you will ever get at a coffee shop. The service is also always great with friendly people to help you decide what your in the mood for. 

Perfect place for gifts or just a sweet treat!
author: Becca W.

description:
I know it's me. I'm the problem. I realize this.

It is just that I expect integrity in business transactions and I always fail to remember what the new 21st century operating principle is: "Do whatever it takes to separate them from their money"

When I go to the Christopher Elbow website and see an item for $24 and then dutifully go to their store to buy it I don't expect to see it for $25.  Of course I got the "There's nothing I can do" brush-off that is SOP now when I mentioned this.

I realize it is just $1 - however I am so very sick of this practice. Isn't it a minor miracle that this nonsense ALWAYS works in their favor? Truly a statistical marvel.  I fully realize that a mistake can be made. I then expect it to be corrected on the spot.

Our time - isn't it just Fab!
author: George S.

description:
A sip of their wonderful hot chocolate will melt all your troubles away! 

Their chocolates are pure art. Once I saved a few pieces for several months just to look at them. Now I have discovered their fruit pate! Delicious fruit jellies with a coating of sugar to offset the tanginess of the fruits. 

Heaven in small pieces.
author: Tony L.

description:
If you've ever wondered what edible art looks like, come on over to Christopher Elbow's. These chocolates taste as beautiful as it looks. Ladies and Gentlemen, inner and outer beauty at its best!

Located in the middle of Hayes Valley, it's close to all the trendy boutiques and fun restaurants nearby. I usually try to stop in whenever I'm in the neighborhood. 

The workers are really good about explaining the flavor profiles of each chocolate morsel and will even offer samples to sway your palate! This is incredibly helpful and far from the days of having to sniff, lick, pinch, and poke your fingers into the mystery Christmas chocolates just to ensure that you didn't get the one with cherry filling. 

If you're looking for high quality, artisanal chocolates bound to cure the cravings of any sugar fiend, then you've found the place! These chocolates cost a little more, but so worth it! Give them a try!
author: Ann S.

description:
$2/piece. $18 for box of 9. Very reasonable for artisan chocolates!

Liked: Strawberry Balsamic (#1!!! packs a punch!), Bananas Foster (mmmm rummyyyy), Champagne, Lemon

Just ok / standard: Raspberry, Fleur de Sel, Coffee

Meh: Cherry Pistachio, Persia

I have to say that for the lemon: I am not a fan of white chocolate anything. In fact, I abhor white chocolate because it's not chocolate.  But the sweetness is so well balanced out by the two types of lemony filling inside that this flavor ranks in the "Like" category.

Beautiful and fresh. But still just **** 3.5 stars ****
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Yummy fancy chocolates! I got the 9 piece box and ate them all during a nearby SF Orchestra show. Hubby got 2 of the larger patties/turtles and ate them both in the store. The limited edition coffee one was so good that I stuff it in my mouth without sharing.

We live in Oakland and took BART, but I wish they were closer. I need more chocolates. The employees were lovely. I'd like to go back (soon) and try the hot chocolate.
author: Ccep D.

description:
Wandering Hayes last weekend with a friend, I decided to make a point of knocking Christopher Elbow off my list of bookmarked chocolate shops. Carrying a wide selection of goods, they had everything from fancy decorated truffles in their display cases, to some 15 varieties of chocolate bars on the shelves, as well as liquid chocolate and more.

Opting to stick with the basics, I picked up a Venezuelan 70% and Fortunato No 4  truffle at $2 a piece, as well as their No 14 Dark 85 Chocolate Bar (an 85% cacao blend) for $7. And, while I can't say I was particularly impressed with the two truffles I had, their No 14 bar was spectacular, with a flavor profile more akin to that of a low 70-some% bar than that of the usual strong, bitter 85%.

So, while their truffles alone would only land them a two star rating, that chocolate bar easily makes them a four, so, let's split the difference shall we?
author: Johnny W.

description: Was walking through Hayes Valley and this shop caught my eye. The chocolates are like little jewels displayed in the store, they look pretty and they taste even better. Their caramels are so smooth and creamy, buttery and salty. The best I have ever had. Loved the nuts too, works well with the sea salt. The only fruit flavor I tried was the raspberry and again it was excellent, very fresh rich raspberry flavor. They are a little pricey but no more so than any other chocolate of this kind, but for the taste quality and presentation I think these are worth it.I have added photos. I found the help to be nice and was offered a sample each time I went. I have to confess I had to return the following day for more :)
author: Karen R.

description: I'm upgrading my original review by one star because the service has really improved. The last few times that I went, the staff was very friendly and I left feeling that even though I spent a ridiculous amount on chocolate, at least they were friendly and helpful.
author: Jorge M.

description:
Let me start by saying 2 things:
1. I rarely give out 5 stars
2. I hated assorted chocolate

I grew up on Sees candy and other cheaper boxes of assorted chocolate. I rarely ever ate the entire box. I also hated biting into a mystery chocolate only to find out I didn't like it.

For Valentine's Day I researched chocolatiers. Christopher Elbow popped up. I called his website store to order, apparently the website is connected to their Ohio(?) location. The promo shipping code I got was only for Ohio residents. I mentioned I was in CA and they shipped me a box with a lesser shipping and gave me the coupon discount. They wound up shipping from the SF location. I told them the date that I would like them to arrive, the Friday before Valentine's. Friday rolls along, BOOM there's my chocolate packed with a cooling bag.

When we opened up the package, there was the salted caramels, the assortment box, and 2 different bars.

My SO and I would eat half and share the other with one another just to try all of the flavors. AND WOW! Literally, everything I tried was PHENOMENAL! The flavors just burst into your mouth with such intensity and subtly at the same time. All of the flavored chocolate that sounded like strange things to have, in a chocolate nugget form, was amazing.

Yes, the chocolates are expensive. But for fresh ingredients in your chocolates and the handcrafted designs. It literally was a guilty pleasure eating such a masterpiece so appealing the eyes.

CE is a great treat!
author: Chantel R.

description: I sent my sister a valentine assortment: She raved for three weeks! When i told her I hadn't had any of these chocolates yet, she sent me a gift certificate.  And I shopped! I really love the Fleur De Sel Pecan Caramels! And all the chocolates are great. Mint chocolate tastes like they pulled mint out of the garden. A dark chocolate salted caramel was, heaven. I'm trying to go slow ... but don't hold me to it!
author: Richard A.

description:
VERY VERY expensive delicate little truffles. They probably have the cutest and most delicately made little treats I've ever encountered. By the piece pricing is around $2 per. 

Salted Caramel truffle was AMAZING! The passion fruit one was pretty good but not too mindblowing.

Bring the credit card... its definitely not Godiva price range!
author: Vicky L.

description:
It's chocolate. Really good chocolate. So good chocolate.

Bought a small box of 9 pieces: fleur de sel, whiskey, fresh lemon, lime vanilla, lavender, Rosemary, strawberry balsamic, passion fruit, and vanilla bean. All were beautiful to look at and tasty but some just knocked our socks off with their flavor. Strawberry balsamic, fresh lemon, lime vanilla, and lavender were those flavors for us.

Staff at Christopher Elbow were very kind and knowledgable about their product.
author: Mary P.

description:
The best hot chocolate I've had in a long, long time. This puts my made-with-love instant hot chocolates to shame.

Not only that, but these treats pack enormous amounts of flavor into barely 1 inch x 1 inch squares of silky, chocolatey goodness. Unfortunately, the price for these things is at least $2 a piece. 

I recommend the lime and tequila, champagne, and wildflower honey for newcomers (and alchs). I can assure you that there'll never be a wait... They're too expensive to cause lines!
author: Colleen M.

description:
Most delicious chocolates ever. Very nice service. You have to go in person so you can get a sample. Make great gifts!!

The boxes are a bit steep, but their bars are phenomenal and well priced ($7). The popping candy bar is addicting. Also highly recommended the citrus bar.
author: Heather K.

description:
My friends and I were excitedly settling in our seats at the Orpheum, getting ready to watch the opening night performance of Motown, the Musical. My friend T. handed over a simple beige box tied up with a chocolate brown ribbon and bow. Unbeknownst to me, the understated box was really a treasure chest that contained tiny jewels of chocolate nirvana. I consider myself a chocolate connoisseur but after one bite of CEAC's chocolate, I humbly acknowledge I was a chocolate Philistine. 

I tried my first chocolate just before the curtain rose. It was the Passion Fruit Caramel. As I broke into the thin outer shell of chocolate, I was hit by an intense blast of fruit that segued into the deep caramelized sweetness of the liquid caramel. 

I was hooked. I next tried the Coconut Caramel. I enjoyed the concentrated coconut flavor but I didn't care for the texture of the dried coconut flakes. It interfered with the smooth perfection of the caramel. I consumed my third chocolate during intermission. The Fleur de Sel Caramel was a perfect blend of salty, sweet and bitter. 

I bit into my last chocolate, the Lavender Caramel, with trepidation. Adding lavender to food is a tricky balancing act. You want to add enough to taste the ingredient but too much and it can taste like you are eating soap. CEAC accomplished this tricky maneuver with ease. No soap in my caramel today.

It is commonly said that we eat with our eyes. If so, CEAC chocolates is definitely a visual feast. However, people tend to be swayed by the pretty packaging but are often disappointed by the lack of flavor once they taste their food. Well I can safely assure you that CEAC is not just pretty packaging. There is substance behind all that beauty. I can't wait to stop by their store and try all the pretty chocolates.
author: Cece E.

description:
Chocolate Heaven. Like one of their slogans, "Almost too beautiful to eat... almost"

I love their Coconut Liquid Chocolate, it's so rich and delicious. This place is perfect to have a cup of hot chocolate and a couple pieces of chocolatey goodness while catching up with a girlfriend. You can just sit, relax, and chat. I love both their spiced and salted Turtles, anything with fleur de sel, in this store is pure goodness. Their pecan toffee is also delicious. Everything there is friggin' delicious, just choose your favorite flavors!

P.S. - Go to their bathroom, I think the sink is really cool & unique :P
author: Stephanie L.

description: This place came highly reviewed and didn't disappoint. I like being able to walk into a high end chocolate shop and get good advice from the staff. That's exactly what they offered. She told us a lot about the chocolates which helped us make a good decision and helped us get excited about the experience. I expected it to be expensive and it was, but not ridiculous. $2/chocolate and a box of 9 that we brought home for a friend for $20. I got the hot chocolate which was very rich. Almost too rich but for a small serving it hit the spot. Probably the best chocolate I've ever had. I can't argue with my friend! Rhecchiuti from earlier this same day was good competition though, it was also very good.
author: Adam B.

description: Chocolatier worth your time and money! My fav has been their cocoa powder and boxed chocolate coated almonds
author: Alex P.

description:
Update:

I think my previous review was too harsh. 

On the plus side there are no chocolates that I am aware of that look as good as these. They make a stunning gift.

However, I still think that the taste is not commensurate with the price point or the aesthetics. The prices are very expensive, but the taste of the chocolate doesn't match the price. :-(
author: A A.

description: We gave boxes as wedding favors.  The flavors were personally chosen per box, fresh and delicious.  Big hit with guests.
author: Susan B.

description:
I was shopping at Aritizia next store and realized I needed to use the restroom. Unfortunately they didn't have a facility there, so it forced me to go into Christopher Elbow next door. Now, I am not the kind of person who feels comfortable using a bathroom without buying something; my dad owns a small business and I believe in quid pro quo. So, I bought a small box of chocolates for $20. I had walked by this place many times and always wondered if their chocolates were any good. 

Their fruity chocolates are what really stand out in my humble opinion. The yellow passionfruit candy, or lemon white chocolate are unlike anything I have ever had! A little expensive, but a wonderful splurge!
author: Serena Q.

description: Insanely good upscale chocolates!  Stopped here early evening after dinner and before a show. Ordered a couple lattes and four of the chocolates. They will blow you away!!! Just check out the pics. They also have a great little set of banquettes to enjoy your just desserts and chat with others.
author: Greg S.

description:
Service was bad bad! The sales person seems to not really like her job.
Couldn't care if we buy or not.
Wonder how much longer this store will stay open there.
author: Linda G.

description:
Bought a Christmas gift for the lady in Christopher elbow...she was so impressed by the aesthetics of the chocolate that she swore she would not eat them! I obviously could not allow this; she was happy I did so because they are soooo tasty. 

Will definitely be back again for a special chocolate-giving occasion. The fun designs make for a unique chocolate experience you don't find in even the best dark chocolate.
author: Max R.

description: Over priced for $2 chocolate that's a size of a quarter. There another place in the city called cocobella that has the same idea and they carry there stuff plus more they got chocolatier from other countries price is bout the same but more selection! The chocolate is ok they have lots of dark which is good. Btw there from Kansas, and everything in Kansas sucks just like there baseball team
author: Mike Y.

description:
Got the following:
hazelnut patty
a russian tea bon bon
a spiced honey bon bon
a mocha with vanilla bean marshmallow
a coconut curry hot chocolate 
a passion fruit caramel bon bon
a banana foster bon bon

Hazelnut patty - there was a thick layer of hazelnut. It was really good. Usually some places have this whipped/buttery texture, but not here. There's also a thin wafer at the bottom giving it a small crunch. You can choose milk chocolate or dark chocolate. 

Russian tea bon bon - not fragrant enough but still good nonetheless. (Go to cocoa bella for the jasmine tea instead)

Spiced honey bon bon - very good. A very good mix of honey and chocolate, with a very slight hint of spice. 

The mocha was really rich. I was afraid that it will taste like other regular mochas from starbucks or whatnot, but I was pleasantly surprised. The mocha was much more rich, much more chocolatey and there was a slight tangy taste I don't know how to describe. Because the chocolate was so rich, I could only taste a hint of espresso. I actually really liked it.   

Coconut curry hot chocolate - the chocolate was too thick and I couldn't taste the difference of the coconut milk, but the curry gave it a little kick after each gulp which was interesting. I would choose the mocha over this though.

Passion fruit caramel bon bon - it had a very strong passion fruit taste mixed with caramel inside a white chocolate shell

Banana foster bon bon - is sorta like banana pudding inside a chocolate shell. I'd rather get an actual banana pudding.

Overall, Chocolate at Cocoa Bella's a wee bit better and they have more selections to choose from. Hot chocolate here is better than Cocoa Bella, but not as good as Max Brenner. So it's a 3.5 star for me.
author: Irene C.

description:
This place has excellent service. The person helping me was very knowledgeable and patient, and gave great recommendations. When I was taking my sweet time chatting and deciding, another customer came in. Shortly after, a gal walked out from the back office to help the other customer. Now, that's service :) 

My favorites are the bananas foster (you can taste the rum!), lemon, and key lime (creamy citrus goodness). I prefer chocolates that are creamy on the inside versus more liquid. So make sure you ask if you have a preference. The chocolates are not only yummy but pretty to look at. A wonderful sweet treat...but watch out, its impossible to eat just one :(
author: Jen Z.

description:
The short version: Have you been here yet? Stop reading and run now. I don't like chocolate and I am addicted

The basics: I was so happy to hear that there was one of these stores on the west coast when I moved to the area. I live 2+ hours away and I will drive out to SF just for this stuff. It is in a busy section of town so finding parking was a bit of an issue. Once I made it to the store I browsed the selection of products available and flagged someone down to get my chocolates. The girl behind the counter was a little stuck up about having to work which irritated me but I did my best to ignore it. I got my goodies and away I went. This is really some of the best chocolate around. Forget Godiva and Ghiradelli you need some of this. Christopher also makes ice cream which he has yet to bring to SF but that needs to happen sooner than later. 

What works: Chocolate!!

What to improve: Staff is a bit uppity. Get the Glace ice cream at this location!!!!!!!!
author: Patrick M.

description:
The chocolate here is nothing short of brilliant. The craftsmanship is impeccable. Seriously.

Just a suggestion though the staff really needs to dress like they are selling expensive chocolates.

Instead they dress like homeless people! Lol

I still love you guys though.
author: Chastity C.

description:
I was very fortunate to receive a box of these precious ones.  Now, it's my turn to spread the love :).

I made a quick call.  Had them prepare my boxes and I dropped in to pick them up.  Very festive with the red bow (in place of the usual brown bow).

All my recepients gave me good compliments.  

Yes, pricey but it's so good, you'll wonder what you just ate. $2/chocolate, they have different sized boxes.  I'm eyeing the complete box temptation of all the flavors for $80.
author: Pam S.

description: What's a girl gotta do when she's had a rough work week? DUH, go get some chocolate and a bottle of wine. After checking out their website, I knew I had to try EVERY single flavor. Walked into the store and grabbed two of their 21 piece box ($42 dollar each). I even got to sample a free chocolate. OH BOY, definitely a mouthgasm. EVERY single piece of chocolate was worth that money I spent. There were probably one or two that I wasn't so fond of, but the rest were delightful! I LOVE PASSION FRUIT, so I saved the Passion Fruit Caramel for last and it was BEYOND delicious. I swear I would stuff a handful of those into my mouth if I could. Overall, absolutely gorgeous looking, sweet, and tasteful chocolates. You can't go wrong!!
author: Betty P.

description: Interesting chocolates and hot cocoa. The assortment of chocolates are made so beautiful that you do not even want to eat them. The hot cocoa that I liked was the PB. So good on a cold day. All in all I was not that impressed with the array of chocolates. I love chocolate and my hips show it, but I prefer Cocoa Bella. Sorry maybe I'll come back to give you another chance, but for now 3 stars.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Amazing chocolate shop in SF. The chocolate is melt-in-your-mouth good, and they look so pretty it made me feel a bit bad putting them in my mouth. 

This is food art at its epitome. 

They have a variety of chocolate bars and drinking chocolate as well. The best thing about this place is probably the little lounge in the back - you can order some liquid chocolate and sip it. It will be choco time instead of tea time.
author: Alice C.

description:
In terms of flavor Chocolatier Blue of Berkeley still reigns supreme, and while the chocolates at Christopher Elbow Chocolates in San Francisco are attractive and beautiful to look at the flavored centers and the chocolate shells just didn't have the explosive taste or the fine texture of my favorite chocolates in the East Bay.

As I'm certain is the case with most chocolatiers which offer a vast selection there will always be hits and misses, and I definitely had some favorites among the Christopher Elbow candies I tried, but in the end I kept wishing the outer layers of their candies were smoother and creamier.
